intro: Pholidia homoplastica, commonly known as the African starfruit or yellow starfruit, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cymes. The fruit, which is edible when ripe, has a tangy flavor and is often used in local cuisines.
